q: if you count Yahoo, and Eric Schmidt recently said in Davos that Facebook is not competition, that it has no intention of going into search. On its face, it seems like a very lopsided duopoly. From my perspective, competition is always a click away. If we don't do the right thing by our users, it takes one word in their browser bar to go to another search engine. We don't even know how the information seeking model will evolve. What you may not think of as competitive today, might very well become the new way of seeking information. "There might be a couple guys in a garage somewhere building the new way of seeking information." on NBC, Colin Powell said that part of the reason he is supporting Barack Obama is because he did not like the negative tone of John McCain 's campaign, which has noted the links between Barack Obama and domestic terrorist Bill Ayers .
